snippet: The photographer Carrie Mae Weems has made a career of representing American life in terms of race, gender and class, often using her own image to illustrate her point of view.
abstract: African-American photographer Carrie Mae Weems, who often poses in her own photos to highlight issues of race, gender and class, is having her first comprehensive retrospective at the Frist Center for the Visual Arts in Nashville.
lead_paragraph: The photographer Carrie Mae Weems has made a career of representing American life in terms of race, gender and class, often using her own image to illustrate her point of view.

headline.seo: Carrie Mae Weems, Photographer and Subject
